This course is designed to provide students with an overview on genome instability which is the major cause of many human diseases and health‐related Understanding, Methodsand Drug Developmentphysiological processes, particularly cancer and aging. Since DNA is the genetic information‐carrier of all forms of life, its integrity and maintenance are extremely important for the biological world. This is underscored by the fact that cellular DNAisunder constant attack from various genotoxic insults. On the other hand, DNA is a popular therapeutic target for anticancer drugdevelopment. Although genome instabilityaverycomplicated subject, this course will focus on understanding the concepts andbasicprinciples, as well as how to apply the knowledge to research and drug development. In addition, as part of the course, general methodology of scientific research andunderstanding will be discussed. Learning objectives: at the end of this course,students are expected to know what is genome and genome stability as well as consequences of genome instability, to gain general understanding of biological research and general aspects of scientific research, and to learn basic strategiesfor therapeutic or drug development. Prerequisite course(s): biology, biochemistry, molecular biology, or equivalent basic biological science courses.

计算流体力学（CFD）是流体力学和计算数学之间形成的交叉学科，它采用计算数学方法求解描述流体运动的偏微分方程组，获得流体运动的定量数据，从而实现流体力学问题的模拟与分析。课程内容分四个部分。第一部分介绍CFD的基本思想，并详细讨论了流体力学的基本方程，要求学生充分理解和重视这些方程的重要性，掌握适合CFD使用的控制方程以及定解条件；第二部分介绍基本的数学离散方法，其中详细讨论了偏微分方程的有限差分方法，这包括有关的基本概念和求解流动问题的一些常用数值解法，要求学生掌握有限差分法的基本思想，网格生成的基本方法以及常用数值解法的基本原理；第三部分讨论了CFD在四个流体力学问题中的应用，这其中的每一个都是从问题引出开始，顺序讲述了控制方程，数值方法，求解过程，一直到获得结果后的总结分析。这可以指导学生了解CFD应用的一般概念和过程，并在完成实践作业的基础上，初步具备解决工程问题的能力；第四部分介绍了现代CFD前沿性的方法和应用，帮助学生掌握当前正在发展中的CFD方法和技术用语。
